episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including unconventional methods to cure phobias, the use of giant wooden matchsticks by the Russian space agency to light rockets, the real-life inspiration behind the film "Who Framed Roger Rabbit," and the history of wristwatches, including the first wristwatch that doubled as a thermometer.

facts.fact: The fear of lifts can be cured by starving the subject and forcing them to eat all of their meals in lifts.
The Russian space agency light their rockets using giant wooden matchsticks.
The film The Who Framed Roger Rabbit is based on a true story.
The first ever wristwatch doubled up as a thermometer.
